Darshan

Analysis & Visualization

I/O performance analysis and monitoring tool for HPC applications. Provides detailed insights into file system usage patterns and performance bottlenecks.

1.0.0 Version
3 Actions
Jan 15 Updated
Python Language

Installation Methods

Global Installation

uv pip install scientific-mcps

Individual MCP Installation

uv pip install "scientific-mcps[darshan]"

Direct Server

uv run mcp_darshan

Claude Desktop Configuration

{ "mcpServers": { "darshan": { "command": "uv", "args": ["run", "mcp_darshan"] } } }

Available Actions

  • analyze_io
    Analyze I/O patterns from Darshan log files
    Parameters: log_file, analysis_type, time_range
  • get_stats
    Extract I/O statistics and performance metrics
    Parameters: log_file, metric_type
  • generate_report
    Generate comprehensive I/O performance reports
    Parameters: log_file, output_format, include_charts

Usage Examples

I/O Performance Analysis

// Analyze I/O patterns analyze_io( log_file: "application.darshan", analysis_type: "bandwidth", time_range: "0:3600" ) // Get performance statistics get_stats("application.darshan", metric_type: "throughput") // Generate comprehensive report generate_report( log_file: "application.darshan", output_format: "html", include_charts: true )

HPC Workflow Integration

// Submit job with Darshan monitoring submit_job( job_script: "#!/bin/bash\n#SBATCH --job-name=io_analysis\ndarshan-enabled-app input.dat", nodes: 4 ) // Analyze results analyze_io("job_output.darshan") // Visualize with plot MCP create_plot(io_stats, "line", "time", "bandwidth")
